title: Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Through Structured Peer Learning in Remote Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic mathematical concepts and practical application experience
context.additional_context: Formative assessment-centered courses to strengthen job relevance for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three math problem-solving strategies through structured peer feedback.
Learners participate in peer review activities at least twice weekly using smartphone-based collaboration tools.
Learners achieve at least 80% incorporation of peer feedback in formative assessments

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Collaboration Platform (e.g., Open-Source Collaboration Tool like KakaoTalk)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
